alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Garza; Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lubbock, Lynn, western Garza, Terry, western Crosby and Hockley Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 915 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow from thunderstorms near Downtown Lubbock, or 4 miles southeast of Lubbock, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lubbock, Levelland, Brownfield, Slaton, Post, Tahoka, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ralls, Lorenzo, Anton, Ransom Canyon, O`donnell, Grassland, New Moore, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Locketville, Slide and Woodrow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for northwestern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Crosby; Garza; Hockley; Lubbock; Lynn; Terry
